subject: RE: [junit] Is there a setUp/tearDown per TestCase?
msgSnippet: Is there a way to make the TestSetup class use *only one object* for all the test methods? It appears as if TestSetup can take a TestSuite object, but that in
messageBody:
Is there a way to make the TestSetup class use *only one object* for all the
test methods?

It appears as if TestSetup can take a TestSuite object, but that in turn
creates multiple Test objects.

It sounds like I'll need to write my own Test derived class to handle this
situation.

Thanks,

-- Rick

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Munish Talwar [mailto:munish.talwar@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 18, 2001 1:42 PM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [junit] Is there a setUp/tearDown per TestCase?
>
>
> You can use junit.extensions.TestSetup class for that
> purpose. Check it
> out.
>
> MT
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Vestal, Rick [mailto:rvestal@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 18, 2001 7:42 AM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: [junit] Is there a setUp/tearDown per TestCase?
>
> Hi,
>
> Is there a set of methods similar to setUp and tearDown that
> are called once
> for all the test methods in a testCase.
>
> i.e. if a class has 2 test methods in it, I want:
>
> setup-method
> test1
> test2
> teardown-method
>
> instead of:
>
> setUp
> test1
> tearDown
> setUp
> test2
> tearDown
>
> Thanks,
>
> -- Rick
>
